intro: Anneslia parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved anneslia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and arranged in a basal rosette. Anneslia parvifolia is often grown in rock gardens due to its compact size and ornamental value.
